text: we sold get up to Microsoft people think
that I went to work at Microsoft I never
worked one day at Microsoft so I just
left I was unemployed and I started
learning Unity I started making games I
started writing go I started writing
rust I started learning a lot of these
languages that I didn't feel like I had
the time to keep up with while I was uh
in CEO mode at GitHub you know the world
had changed a lot since we spoke on
podcast number 10 so I wanted to learn
the new technologies significantly um so
I made a fake GitHub account with a fake
name which is a trick I learned from
techno weeni and I just started hacking
on stuff sending pool requests um
getting really involved in whatever I
was interested in weird weirdo languages
um goer things like that and along the
way I was getting into learning assembly
learning about CPUs learning about like
binary math stuff that I'd never learned
before because I don't have a CS
background and that kind of led me to
the serenity OS Project and you know
here they are building an operating
system from scratch they're doing it in
C++ which was also a language that I'd
never done before that I was learning
and so I started following Andreas
really early I think I was one of the
first patreon subscribers as well on
Serenity so I'd watched that for years
and years and years and I saw when lib
web was created and followed the
JavaScript engine a little bit um but I
separately had been really interested in
open source web browsers I was an early
supporter of Firefox back when they I
tweeted this recently but um Firefox .0
that had a campaign to crowdsource and
AD in the New York Times it was two
pages I think I was 18 or 19 years old
so I put in whatever five 10 15 bucks um
and got my name in the paper so I was a
huge Firefox supporter at that time I
was running all Linux on all my machines
and you know obviously Firefox has
become a small part of what the Mozilla
Foundation is doing meanwhile Chrome and
chromium and Google have really taken
over the web so I've been thinking for a
while not that I was going to write a
browser but I would love to find some
folks who are interested in this and get
involved and help in any way I can and
so I watched ladybird sort of evolved
from afar and when Andreas and I started
talking um I felt like it was the
perfect fit I mean because he he had
already been doing it he had the um
experience he had the team he'd proven
he could run a project already with
Serenity and I just felt like I could
help fill in some of the gaps in terms
of the legal side the business side and
some of the funding so it was really an
amazing sort of coincidence in situation
from my perspective
[Music]
